   20: 
   21: -module(otp_SUITE).
   22: 
   23: -export([all/0, suite/0,
   24:          init_per_suite/1,end_per_suite/1]).
   25: -export([undefined_functions/1,deprecated_not_in_obsolete/1,
   26:          obsolete_but_not_deprecated/1,call_to_deprecated/1,
   27:          call_to_size_1/1,call_to_now_0/1,strong_components/1,
   28:          erl_file_encoding/1,xml_file_encoding/1,
   29:          runtime_dependencies_functions/1,
   30:          runtime_dependencies_modules/1,
   31:          test_runtime_dependencies_versions/1]).
   32: 
   33: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   34: 
   35: -import(lists, [filter/2,foldl/3,foreach/2]).
   36: 
   37: suite() ->
   38:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
   39:      {timetrap, {minutes, 30}}].
   40: 
   41: all() ->
   42:     [undefined_functions, deprecated_not_in_obsolete,
   43:      obsolete_but_not_deprecated, call_to_deprecated,
   44:      call_to_size_1, call_to_now_0, strong_components,
   45:      erl_file_encoding, xml_file_encoding,
   46:      runtime_dependencies_functions,
   47:      runtime_dependencies_modules,
   48:      test_runtime_dependencies_versions
   49: ].
   50: 
   51: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   52:     Server = start_xref_server(daily_xref, functions, Config),
   53:     [{xref_server,Server}|Config].
   54: 
   55: end_per_suite(Config) ->
   56:     Server = proplists:get_value(xref_server, Config),
   57:     catch xref:stop(Server),
   58:     Config.
   59: 
   60: undefined_functions(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   61:     Server = proplists:get_value(xref_server, Config),
   62: 
   63:     %% Exclude calls from generated modules in the SSL application.
   64:     ExcludeFrom = "SSL-PKIX|PKIX.*|ssl_pkix_oid",
   65:     UndefS = xref_base:analysis(undefined_function_calls),
   66:     Q = io_lib:format("Undef = ~s,"
   67:                       "ExcludedFrom = ~p:_/_,"
   68:                       "Undef - Undef | ExcludedFrom",
   69:                       [UndefS,ExcludeFrom]),
   70:     {ok,Undef0} = xref:q(Server, lists:flatten(Q)),
   71: 
   72:     Filters = [fun erts_filter/1,
   73:                fun ssl_crypto_filter/1,
   74:                fun eunit_filter/1,
   75:                fun dialyzer_filter/1,
   76:                fun wx_filter/1,
   77:                fun diameter_filter/1],
   78:     Undef = lists:foldl(fun(Filter, Acc) ->
   79:                                 Filter(Acc)
   80:                         end, Undef0, Filters),
   81: 
   82:     case Undef of
   83:         [] -> ok;
   84:         _ ->
   85:             Fd = open_log(Config, "undefined_functions"),
   86:             foreach(fun ({MFA1,MFA2}) ->
   87:                             ct:pal("~s calls undefined ~s",
   88:                                    [format_mfa(Server, MFA1),
   89:                                     format_mfa(MFA2)]),
   90:                             io:format(Fd, "~s ~s\n",
   91:                                       [format_mfa(Server, MFA1),
   92:                                        format_mfa(MFA2)])
   93:                     end, Undef),
   94:             close_log(Fd),
   95:             ct:fail({length(Undef),undefined_functions_in_otp})
   96:     end.
   97: 
   98: ssl_crypto_filter(Undef) ->
   99:     case {app_exists(crypto),app_exists(ssl)} of
  100:         {false,false} ->
  101:             filter(fun({_,{ssl,_,_}}) -> false;
  102:                       ({_,{crypto,_,_}}) -> false;
  103:                       ({_,{ssh,_,_}}) -> false;
  104:                       ({_,{ssh_connection,_,_}}) -> false;
  105:                       ({_,{ssh_sftp,_,_}}) -> false;
  106:                       (_) -> true
  107:                    end, Undef);
  108:         {_,_} -> Undef
  109:     end.
  110: 
  111: eunit_filter(Undef) ->
  112:     filter(fun({{eunit_test,wrapper_test_exported_,0},
  113:                 {eunit_test,nonexisting_function,0}}) -> false;
  114:               (_) -> true
  115:            end, Undef).
  116: 
  117: dialyzer_filter(Undef) ->
  118:     case app_exists(dialyzer) of
  119:         false ->
  120:             filter(fun({_,{dialyzer_callgraph,_,_}}) -> false;
  121:                       ({_,{dialyzer_codeserver,_,_}}) -> false;
  122:                       ({_,{dialyzer_contracts,_,_}}) -> false;
  123:                       ({_,{dialyzer_cl_parse,_,_}}) -> false;
  124:                       ({_,{dialyzer_timing,_,_}}) -> false;
  125:                       ({_,{dialyzer_plt,_,_}}) -> false;
  126:                       ({_,{dialyzer_succ_typings,_,_}}) -> false;
  127:                       ({_,{dialyzer_utils,_,_}}) -> false;
  128:                       (_) -> true
  129:                    end, Undef);
  130:         _ -> Undef
  131:     end.
  132: 
  133: wx_filter(Undef) ->
  134:     case app_exists(wx) of
  135:         false ->
  136:             filter(fun({_,{i, _, _}}) -> false;
  137:                       ({_,{dbg_iserver, _, _}}) -> false;
  138:                       ({_,{et_selector, _, _}}) -> false;
  139:                       ({_,{et_viewer, _, _}}) -> false;
  140:                       ({_,{int, _, _}}) -> false;
  141:                       ({_,{MaybeWxModule,_,_}}) ->
  142:                            case atom_to_list(MaybeWxModule) of
  143:                                "wx"++_ -> false;
  144:                                _ -> true
  145:                            end
  146:                    end, Undef);
  147:         _ -> Undef
  148:     end.
  149: 
  150: diameter_filter(Undef) ->
  151:     %% Filter away function calls that are caught.
  152:     filter(fun({{diameter_lib,_,_},{erlang,convert_time_unit,3}}) ->
  153:                    false;
  154:               ({{diameter_lib,_,_},{erlang,monotonic_time,0}}) ->
  155:                    false;
  156:               ({{diameter_lib,_,_},{erlang,unique_integer,0}}) ->
  157:                    false;
  158:               ({{diameter_lib,_,_},{erlang,time_offset,0}}) ->
  159:                    false;
  160:               (_) -> true
  161:            end, Undef).
  162: 
  163: erts_filter(Undef) ->
  164:     filter(fun({_,{prim_socket,_,_}}) -> lists:member(prim_socket, erlang:pre_loaded());
  165:               ({_,{prim_net,_,_}}) -> lists:member(prim_net, erlang:pre_loaded());
  166:               ({_,{socket_registry,_,_}}) -> lists:member(socket_registry, erlang:pre_loaded());
  167:               (_) -> true
  168:            end, Undef).
  169: 
  170: deprecated_not_in_obsolete(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  171:     Server = proplists:get_value(xref_server, Config),
  172:     {ok,DeprecatedFunctions} = xref:q(Server, "DF"),
  173: 
  174:     L = foldl(fun({M,F,A}=MFA, Acc) ->
  175:                       case otp_internal:obsolete(M, F, A) of
  176:                           no -> [MFA|Acc];
  177:                           _ -> Acc
  178:                       end
  179:               end, [], DeprecatedFunctions),
  180:     case L of
  181:         [] -> ok;
  182:         _ ->
  183:             io:put_chars("The following functions have -deprecated() attributes,\n"
  184:                          "but are not listed in otp_internal:obsolete/3.\n"),
  185:             print_mfas(group_leader(), Server, L),
  186:             Fd = open_log(Config, "deprecated_not_obsolete"),
  187:             print_mfas(Fd, Server, L),
  188:             close_log(Fd),
  189:             ct:fail({length(L),deprecated_but_not_obsolete})
  190:     end.
  191: 
  192: obsolete_but_not_deprecated(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  193:     Server = proplists:get_value(xref_server, Config),
  194:     {ok,NotDeprecated} = xref:q(Server, "X - DF"),
  195: 
  196:     L = foldl(fun({M,F,A}=MFA, Acc) ->
  197:                       case otp_internal:obsolete(M, F, A) of
  198:                           no -> Acc;
  199:                           _ -> [MFA|Acc]
  200:                       end
  201:               end, [], NotDeprecated),
  202: 
  203:     case L of
  204:         [] -> ok;
  205:         _ ->
  206:             io:put_chars("The following functions are listed "
  207:                          "in otp_internal:obsolete/3,\n"
  208:                          "but don't have -deprecated() attributes.\n"),
  209:             print_mfas(group_leader(), Server, L),
  210:             Fd = open_log(Config, "obsolete_not_deprecated"),
  211:             print_mfas(Fd, Server, L),
  212:             close_log(Fd),
  213:             ct:fail({length(L),obsolete_but_not_deprecated})
  214:     end.
  215: 
  216: call_to_deprecated(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  217:     Server = proplists:get_value(xref_server, Config),
  218:     {ok,DeprecatedCalls} = xref:q(Server, "strict(E || DF)"),
  219:     foreach(fun ({MFA1,MFA2}) ->
  220:                     io:format("~s calls deprecated ~s",
  221:                               [format_mfa(MFA1),format_mfa(MFA2)])
  222:             end, DeprecatedCalls),
  223:     {comment,integer_to_list(length(DeprecatedCalls))++" calls to deprecated functions"}.
  224: 
  225: call_to_size_1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  226:     %% Forbid the use of erlang:size/1 in all applications.
  227:     Apps = all_otp_applications(Config),
  228:     not_recommended_calls(Config, Apps, {erlang,size,1}).
  229: 
  230: call_to_now_0(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  231:     %% Forbid the use of erlang:now/1 in all applications except et.
  232:     Apps = all_otp_applications(Config) -- [et],
  233:     not_recommended_calls(Config, Apps, {erlang,now,0}).
  234: 
  235: not_recommended_calls(Config, Apps0, MFA) ->
  236:     Server = proplists:get_value(xref_server, Config),
  237: 
  238:     Apps = [App || App <- Apps0, is_present_application(App, Server)],
  239: 
  240:     Fs = [MFA],
  241: 
  242:     Q1 = io_lib:format("E || ~p : Fun", [Fs]),
  243:     {ok,AllCallsToMFA} = xref:q(Server, lists:flatten(Q1)),
  244: 
  245:     Q2 = io_lib:format("E | ~p : App || ~p : Fun", [Apps,Fs]),
  246:     {ok,CallsToMFA} = xref:q(Server, lists:flatten(Q2)),
  247: 
  248:     case CallsToMFA of
  249:         [] ->
  250:             ok;
  251:         _ ->
  252:             io:format("These calls are not allowed:\n"),
  253:             foreach(fun ({MFA1,MFA2}) ->
  254:                             io:format("~s calls non-recommended ~s",
  255:                                       [format_mfa(MFA1),format_mfa(MFA2)])
  256:                     end, CallsToMFA)
  257:     end,
  258: 
  259:     %% Enumerate calls to MFA from other applications than
  260:     %% the ones known not to call MFA:
  261:     case AllCallsToMFA--CallsToMFA of
  262:         [] ->
  263:             ok;
  264:         Calls ->
  265:             io:format("~n~nThese calls are allowed for now:\n"),
  266:             foreach(fun ({MFA1,MFA2}) ->
  267:                             io:format("~s calls non-recommended ~s",
  268:                                       [format_mfa(MFA1),format_mfa(MFA2)])
  269:                     end, Calls)
  270:     end,
  271:     case CallsToMFA of
  272:         [] ->
  273:             SkippedApps = ordsets:subtract(ordsets:from_list(Apps0),
  274:                                            ordsets:from_list(Apps)),
  275:             case SkippedApps of
  276:                 [] ->
  277:                     ok;
  278:                 _ ->
  279:                     AppStrings = [atom_to_list(A) || A <- SkippedApps],
  280:                     Mess = io_lib:format("Application(s) not present: ~s\n",
  281:                                          [lists:join(", ", AppStrings)]),
  282:                     {comment, Mess}
  283:             end;
  284:         _ ->
  285:             ct:fail({length(CallsToMFA),calls_to,MFA})
  286:     end.
  287: 
  288: all_otp_applications(Config) ->
  289:     Server = proplists:get_value(xref_server, Config),
  290:     {ok,AllApplications} = xref:q(Server, "A"),
  291:     OtpAppsMap = get_otp_applications(Config),
  292:     [App || App <- AllApplications, is_map_key(App, OtpAppsMap)].
  293: 
  294: get_otp_applications(Config) ->
  295:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  296:     [Current|_] = read_otp_version_table(DataDir),
  297:     read_version_lines([Current]).
  298: 
  299: is_present_application(Name, Server) ->
  300:     Q = io_lib:format("~w : App", [Name]),
  301:     case xref:q(Server, lists:flatten(Q)) of
  302:         {ok,[Name]} -> true;
  303:         {error,_,_} -> false
  304:     end.
  305: 
  306: strong_components(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  307:     Server = proplists:get_value(xref_server, Config),
  308:     {ok,Cs} = xref:q(Server, "components AE"),
  309:     io:format("\n\nStrong components:\n\n~p\n", [Cs]),
  310:     ok.
  311: 
  312: erl_file_encoding(_Config) ->
  313:     Root = code:root_dir(),
  314:     Wc = filename:join([Root,"**","*.erl"]),
  315:     ErlFiles = ordsets:subtract(ordsets:from_list(filelib:wildcard(Wc)),
  316:                                 release_files(Root, "*.erl")),
  317:     {ok, MP} = re:compile(".*lib/(ic)|(orber)|(cos).*", [unicode]),
  318:     Fs = [F || F <- ErlFiles,
  319:                filter_use_latin1_coding(F, MP),
  320:                case epp:read_encoding(F) of
  321:                    none -> false;
  322:                    _ -> true
  323:                end],
  324:     case Fs of
  325:         [] ->
  326:             ok;
  327:         [_|_] ->
  328:             io:put_chars("Files with \"coding:\":\n"),
  329:             [io:put_chars(F) || F <- Fs],
  330:             ct:fail(failed)
  331:     end.
  332: 
  333: filter_use_latin1_coding(F, MP) ->
  334:     case re:run(F, MP) of
  335:         nomatch ->
  336:             true;
  337:         {match, _} ->
  338:             false
  339:     end.
  340: 
  341: xml_file_encoding(_Config) ->
  342:     XmlFiles = xml_files(),
  343:     Fs = [F || F <- XmlFiles, is_bad_encoding(F)],
  344:     case Fs of
  345:         [] ->
  346:             ok;
  347:         [_|_] ->
  348:             io:put_chars("Encoding should be \"utf-8\" or \"UTF-8\":\n"),
  349:             [io:put_chars(F) || F <- Fs],
  350:             ct:fail(failed)
  351:     end.
  352: 
  353: xml_files() ->
  354:     Root = code:root_dir(),
  355:     AllWc = filename:join([Root,"**","*.xml"]),
  356:     AllXmlFiles = ordsets:from_list(filelib:wildcard(AllWc)),
  357:     TestsWc = filename:join([Root,"lib","*","test","**","*.xml"]),
  358:     TestXmlFiles = ordsets:from_list(filelib:wildcard(TestsWc)),
  359:     XmerlWc = filename:join([Root,"lib","xmerl","**","*.xml"]),
  360:     XmerlXmlFiles = ordsets:from_list(filelib:wildcard(XmerlWc)),
  361:     Ignore = ordsets:union([TestXmlFiles,XmerlXmlFiles,
  362:                             release_files(Root, "*.xml")]),
  363:     ordsets:subtract(AllXmlFiles, Ignore).
  364: 
  365: release_files(Root, Ext) ->
  366:     Wc = filename:join([Root,"release","**",Ext]),
  367:     filelib:wildcard(Wc).
  368: 
  369: is_bad_encoding(File) ->
  370:     {ok,Bin} = file:read_file(File),
  371:     case Bin of
  372:         <<"<?xml version=\"1.0\" encoding=\"utf-8\"",_/binary>> ->
  373:             false;
  374:         <<"<?xml version=\"1.0\" encoding=\"UTF-8\"",_/binary>> ->
  375:             false;
  376:         _ ->
  377:             true
  378:     end.
  379: 
  380: %% Test runtime dependencies when using an Xref server running in
  381: %% 'functions' mode.
  382: 
  383: runtime_dependencies_functions(Config) ->
  384:     Server = proplists:get_value(xref_server, Config),
  385:     runtime_dependencies(Server).
  386: 
  387: %% Test runtime dependencies when using an xref server running in
  388: %% 'modules' mode. Note that more module edges can potentially be
  389: %% found in this mode because the analysis is based on the BEAM
  390: %% code after all optimizations. For example, an apply in the source
  391: %% code could after optimizations be resolved to a specific function.
  392: %%
  393: %% It is important to test 'modules' because reltool runs xref in
  394: %% 'modules' mode (the BEAM files to be released might not contain
  395: %% debug information).
  396: 
  397: runtime_dependencies_modules(Config) ->
  398:     Server = start_xref_server(?FUNCTION_NAME, modules, Config),
  399:     try
  400:         runtime_dependencies(Server)
  401:     after
  402:         catch xref:stop(Server)
  403:     end.
  404: 
  405: runtime_dependencies(Server) ->
  406:     %% Ignore applications intentionally not declaring dependencies
  407:     %% found by xref.
  408:     IgnoreApps = [diameter],
  409: 
  410:     %% Verify that (at least) OTP application runtime dependencies found
  411:     %% by xref are listed in the runtime_dependencies field of the .app file
  412:     %% of each application.
  413:     {ok, AE} = xref:q(Server, "AE"),
  414:     SAE = lists:keysort(1, AE),
  415:     put(ignored_failures, []),
  416:     {AppDep, AppDeps} = lists:foldl(fun ({App, App}, Acc) ->
  417:                                             Acc;
  418:                                         ({App, Dep}, {undefined, []}) ->
  419:                                             {{App, [Dep]}, []};
  420:                                         ({App, Dep}, {{App, Deps}, AppDeps}) ->
  421:                                             {{App, [Dep|Deps]}, AppDeps};
  422:                                         ({App, Dep}, {AppDep, AppDeps}) ->
  423:                                             {{App, [Dep]}, [AppDep | AppDeps]}
  424:                                     end,
  425:                                     {undefined, []},
  426:                                     SAE),
  427:     [] = check_apps_deps([AppDep|AppDeps], IgnoreApps),
  428:     case IgnoreApps of
  429:         [] ->
  430:             ok;
  431:         _ ->
  432:             Comment = lists:flatten(io_lib:format("Ignored applications: ~p "
  433:                                                   "Ignored failures: ~p",
  434:                                                   [IgnoreApps,
  435:                                                    get(ignored_failures)])),
  436:             {comment, Comment}
  437:     end.
  438: 
  439: have_rdep(_App, [], _Dep) ->
  440:     false;
  441: have_rdep(App, [RDep | RDeps], Dep) ->		    
  442:     [AppStr, _VsnStr] = string:lexemes(RDep, "-"),
  443:     case Dep == list_to_atom(AppStr) of
  444:         true ->
  445:             %% io:format("~p -> ~s~n", [App, RDep]),
  446:             true;
  447:         false ->
  448:             have_rdep(App, RDeps, Dep)
  449:     end.
  450: 
  451: check_app_deps(_App, _AppFile, _AFDeps, [], _IgnoreApps) ->
  452:     [];
  453: check_app_deps(App, AppFile, AFDeps, [XRDep | XRDeps], IgnoreApps) ->
  454:     ResOtherDeps = check_app_deps(App, AppFile, AFDeps, XRDeps, IgnoreApps),
  455:     case have_rdep(App, AFDeps, XRDep) of
  456:         true ->
  457:             ResOtherDeps;
  458:         false ->
  459:             Failure = {missing_runtime_dependency, AppFile, XRDep},
  460:             case lists:member(App, IgnoreApps) of
  461:                 true ->
  462:                     put(ignored_failures, [Failure | get(ignored_failures)]),
  463:                     ResOtherDeps;
  464:                 false ->
  465:                     [Failure | ResOtherDeps]
  466:             end
  467:     end.
  468: 
  469: check_apps_deps([], _IgnoreApps) ->
  470:     [];
  471: check_apps_deps([{App, Deps}|AppDeps], IgnoreApps) ->
  472:     ResOtherApps = check_apps_deps(AppDeps, IgnoreApps),
  473:     AppFile = code:where_is_file(atom_to_list(App) ++ ".app"),
  474:     {ok,[{application, App, Info}]} = file:consult(AppFile),
  475:     case lists:keyfind(runtime_dependencies, 1, Info) of
  476:         {runtime_dependencies, RDeps} ->
  477:             check_app_deps(App, AppFile, RDeps, Deps, IgnoreApps)
  478:             ++ ResOtherApps;
  479:         false ->
  480:             Failure = {missing_runtime_dependencies_key, AppFile},
  481:             case lists:member(App, IgnoreApps) of
  482:                 true ->
  483:                     put(ignored_failures, [Failure | get(ignored_failures)]),
  484:                     ResOtherApps;
  485:                 false ->
  486:                     [Failure | ResOtherApps]
  487:             end
  488:     end.
  489: 
  490: %%
  491: %% Test that the runtime dependencies have not become stale.
  492: %%
  493: 
  494: %% Path of installed OTP releases.
  495: -define(OTP_RELEASES, "/usr/local/otp/releases").
  496: 
  497: %% Wildcard to match all releases from OTP 17.
  498: -define(OTP_RELEASE_WC, "{sles10_64_17_patched,ubuntu16_64_*_patched}").
  499: 
  500: test_runtime_dependencies_versions(Config) ->
  501:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  502: 
  503:     OtpReleases = ?OTP_RELEASES,
  504:     OtpReleasesWc = filename:join(OtpReleases, ?OTP_RELEASE_WC),
  505: 
  506:     IgnoreApps = [],
  507:     IgnoreUndefs = ignore_undefs(),
  508: 
  509:     FirstVersionForApp = get_first_app_versions(DataDir),
  510: 
  511:     case {element(1, os:type()) =:= unix,
  512:           not is_development_build(DataDir),
  513:           filelib:is_dir(OtpReleases)} of
  514:         {true, true, true} ->
  515:             test_runtime_dependencies_versions_rels(
  516:               IgnoreApps,
  517:               IgnoreUndefs,
  518:               FirstVersionForApp,
  519:               OtpReleasesWc);
  520:         {false, _, _} ->
  521:             {skip, "This test only runs on Unix systems"};
  522:         {_, false, _} ->
  523:             {skip,
  524:              "This test case is designed to run in the Erlang/OTP teams "
  525:              "test system for daily tests. The test case depends on that "
  526:              "app versions have been set correctly by scripts that "
  527:              "are executed before creating builds for the daily tests."};
  528:         {_, _ ,false} ->
  529:             {skip, "Can not do the tests without a proper releases dir. "
  530:              "Check that " ++ OtpReleases ++ " is set up correctly."}
  531:     end.
  532: 
  533: ignore_undefs() ->
  534:     Socket = case lists:member(prim_socket, erlang:pre_loaded()) of
  535:                  true ->
  536:                      #{};
  537:                  false ->
  538:                      Ignore = #{{prim_socket,'_','_'} => true,
  539:                                 {socket_registry,'_','_'} => true,
  540:                                 {prim_net,'_','_'} => true },
  541:                      #{kernel => Ignore, erts => Ignore}
  542:              end,
  543:     Socket#{eunit =>
  544:                 %% Intentional call to nonexisting function
  545:                 #{{eunit_test, nonexisting_function, 0} => true},
  546:             diameter =>
  547:                 %% The following functions are optional dependencies for diameter
  548:                 #{{dbg,ctp,0} => true,
  549:                   {dbg,p,2} => true,
  550:                   {dbg,stop,0} => true,
  551:                   {dbg,trace_port,2} => true,
  552:                   {dbg,tracer,2} => true,
  553:                   {erl_prettypr,format,1} => true,
  554:                   {erl_syntax,form_list,1} => true},
  555:             common_test =>
  556:                 %% ftp:start/0 has been part of the ftp application from
  557:                 %% the beginning so it is unclear why xref report this
  558:                 %% as undefined
  559:                 #{{ftp,start,0} => true}}.
  560: 
  561: %% Read the otp_versions.table file and create a mapping from application name
  562: %% the first version for each application.
  563: get_first_app_versions(DataDir) ->
  564:     Lines = read_otp_version_table(DataDir),
  565:     read_version_lines(Lines).
  566: 
  567: test_runtime_dependencies_versions_rels(IgnoreApps, IgnoreUndefs,
  568:                                         FirstVersionForApp, OtpReleasesWc) ->
  569:     AppVersionToPath = version_to_path(OtpReleasesWc),
  570:     Deps = [Dep || {App,_,_}=Dep <- get_deps(FirstVersionForApp),
  571:                    not lists:member(App, IgnoreApps)],
  572:     case test_deps(Deps, IgnoreUndefs, AppVersionToPath, FirstVersionForApp) of
  573:         [] ->
  574:             ok;
  575:         [_|_]=Undefs ->
  576:             _ = [print_undefs(Undef) || Undef <- Undefs],
  577:             ct:fail({length(Undefs),errors})
  578:     end.
  579: 
  580: print_undefs({_App,AppPath,Deps,Undefs}) ->
  581:     App = filename:basename(filename:dirname(AppPath)),
  582:     io:format("Undefined functions in ~ts:", [App]),
  583:     io:put_chars([io_lib:format("  ~p:~p/~p\n", [M,F,A]) ||
  584:                      {M,F,A} <- Undefs]),
  585:     io:format("Dependencies: ~ts\n", [lists:join(" ", Deps)]).
  586: 
  587: version_to_path(OtpReleasesWc) ->
  588:     CurrentWc = filename:join([code:lib_dir(), "*-*", "ebin"]),
  589:     LibWc = filename:join([OtpReleasesWc, "lib", "*-*", "ebin"]),
  590:     Dirs = lists:sort(filelib:wildcard(CurrentWc) ++ filelib:wildcard(LibWc)),
  591:     All = [{filename:basename(filename:dirname(Dir)),Dir} || Dir <- Dirs],
  592:     maps:from_list(All).
  593: 
  594: get_deps(FirstVersionForApp) ->
  595:     Paths = [begin
  596:                  Dir = filename:dirname(Path),
  597:                  [App0 | _] = string:split(filename:basename(Dir), "-"),
  598:                  App = list_to_atom(App0),
  599:                  AppFile = filename:join(Path, App0 ++ ".app"),
  600:                  {Path, App, AppFile}
  601:              end || Path <- code:get_path(),
  602:                     filename:basename(Path) =:= "ebin"],
  603:     %% Only keep applications included in OTP.
  604:     Apps = [Triple || {_, App, AppFile}=Triple <- Paths,
  605:                       filelib:is_file(AppFile),
  606:                       is_map_key(App, FirstVersionForApp)],
  607:     [{App, Path, get_runtime_deps(App, AppFile)} || {Path, App, AppFile} <- Apps].
  608: 
  609: get_runtime_deps(App, AppFile) ->
  610:     {ok,[{application, App, Info}]} = file:consult(AppFile),
  611:     case lists:keyfind(runtime_dependencies, 1, Info) of
  612:         {runtime_dependencies, RDeps} ->
  613:             RDeps;
  614:         false ->
  615:             []
  616:     end.
  617: 
  618: test_deps([{Name,Path,Deps}|Apps], IgnoreUndefs, AppVersionToPath, FirstVersionForApp) ->
  619:     case test_dep(Name, Path, Deps, AppVersionToPath, FirstVersionForApp, IgnoreUndefs) of
  620:         ok ->
  621:             test_deps(Apps, IgnoreUndefs, AppVersionToPath, FirstVersionForApp);
  622:         {error, Error} ->
  623:             [Error|test_deps(Apps, IgnoreUndefs, AppVersionToPath, FirstVersionForApp)]
  624:     end;
  625: test_deps([], _IgnoreUndefs, _AppVersionToPath, _FirstVersionForApp) ->
  626:     [].
  627: 
  628: test_dep(App, AppPath, Deps, AppVersionToPath, FirstVersionForApp, IgnoreUndefs) ->
  629:     DepPaths = [get_app_path(Dep, AppVersionToPath, FirstVersionForApp, App) ||
  630:                    Dep <- Deps],
  631: 
  632:     Server = xref_server_test_dep,
  633:     {ok, _} = xref:start(Server, []),
  634:     xref:set_default(Server, [{verbose,false},
  635:                               {warnings,false},
  636:                               {builtins,true}]),
  637:     ok = xref:set_library_path(Server, DepPaths),
  638:     {ok, _} = xref:add_directory(Server, AppPath),
  639:     {ok, Undef0} = xref:analyze(Server, undefined_functions),
  640:     xref:stop(Server),
  641: 
  642:     %% Filter out undefined functions that we should ignore.
  643:     Ignore = maps:get(App, IgnoreUndefs, #{}),
  644:     Undef = [MFA || {M,F,_A}=MFA <- Undef0,
  645:                     not is_map_key(MFA, Ignore),
  646:                     not is_map_key({M,'_','_'}, Ignore),
  647:                     not is_map_key({M,F,'_'}, Ignore)],
  648:     case Undef of
  649:         [] ->
  650:             ok;
  651:         [_|_] ->
  652:             {error, {App, AppPath, Deps, Undef}}
  653:     end.
  654: 
  655: get_app_path(App, AppVersionToPath, FirstVersionForApp, ReferencedBy) ->
  656:     case AppVersionToPath of
  657:         #{App := Path} ->
  658:             Path;
  659:         #{} ->
  660:             [Name0, _Version] = string:split(App, "-"),
  661:             Name = list_to_existing_atom(Name0),
  662:             First = map_get(Name, FirstVersionForApp),
  663:             io:format("WARNING: ~ts referenced by ~ts is too old; using ~ts instead\n",
  664:                       [App, ReferencedBy, First]),
  665:             map_get(First, AppVersionToPath)
  666:     end.
  667: 
  668: is_development_build(DataDir) ->
  669:     OTPVersionTicketsPath = filename:join(DataDir, "otp_version_tickets"),
  670:     {ok, FileContentBin} = file:read_file(OTPVersionTicketsPath),
  671:     string:trim(binary_to_list(FileContentBin), both, "\n ") =:= "DEVELOPMENT".
  672: 
  673: %%%
  674: %%% Common help functions.
  675: %%%
  676: 
  677: print_mfas(Fd, Server, MFAs) ->
  678:     [io:format(Fd, "~s\n", [format_mfa(Server, MFA)]) || MFA <- MFAs],
  679:     ok.
  680: 
  681: format_mfa({M,F,A}) ->
  682:     lists:flatten(io_lib:format("~s:~s/~p", [M,F,A])).
  683: 
  684: format_mfa(Server, MFA) ->
  685:     MFAString = format_mfa(MFA),
  686:     AQ = "(App)" ++ MFAString,
  687:     AppPrefix = case xref:q(Server, AQ) of
  688:                     {ok,[App]} -> "[" ++ atom_to_list(App) ++ "]";
  689:                     _ -> ""
  690:                 end,
  691:     AppPrefix ++ MFAString.
  692: 
  693: open_log(Config, Name) ->
  694:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  695:     RunDir = filename:dirname(filename:dirname(PrivDir)),
  696:     Path = filename:join(RunDir, "system_"++Name++".log"),
  697:     {ok,Fd} = file:open(Path, [write]),
  698:     Fd.
  699: 
  700: close_log(Fd) ->
  701:     ok = file:close(Fd).
  702: 
  703: app_exists(AppAtom) ->
  704:     case code:lib_dir(AppAtom) of
  705:         {error,bad_name} ->
  706:             false;
  707:         Path ->
  708:             case file:read_file_info(filename:join(Path,"ebin")) of
  709:                 {ok,_} ->
  710:                     true;
  711:                 _ ->
  712:                     false
  713:             end
  714:     end.
  715: 
  716: start_xref_server(Server, Mode, _Config) ->
  717:     Root = code:root_dir(),
  718:     xref:start(Server, [{xref_mode,Mode}]),
  719:     xref:set_default(Server, [{verbose,false},
  720:                               {warnings,false},
  721:                               {builtins,true}]),
  722:     {ok,_Relname} = xref:add_release(Server, Root, {name,otp}),
  723: 
  724:     case code:lib_dir(erts) of
  725:         {error,bad_name} ->
  726:             %% This should not be possible since code_server always adds
  727:             %% an entry for erts.
  728:             ct:fail(no_erts_lib_dir);
  729:         LibDir ->
  730:             ErtsEbin = lists:flatten(filename:join(LibDir, "ebin")),
  731:             case lists:member(ErtsEbin, code:get_path()) of
  732:                 false ->
  733:                     %% If we are running the tests in the git repository,
  734:                     %% the preloaded BEAM files for Erts are not in the
  735:                     %% code path. We must add them explicitly.
  736:                     {ok,_} = xref:add_directory(Server, ErtsEbin, []);
  737:                 true ->
  738:                     ok
  739:             end
  740:     end,
  741: 
  742:     Server.
  743: 
  744: read_otp_version_table(DataDir) ->
  745:     VersionTableFile = filename:join(DataDir, "otp_versions.table"),
  746:     {ok, Contents} = file:read_file(VersionTableFile),
  747:     binary:split(Contents, <<"\n">>, [global,trim]).
  748: 
  749: read_version_lines(Lines) ->
  750:     read_version_lines(Lines, #{}).
  751: 
  752: read_version_lines([Line|Lines], Map0) ->
  753:     [<<"OTP-",_/binary>>, <<":">> | Apps] = binary:split(Line, <<" ">>, [global,trim]),
  754:     Map = lists:foldl(fun(App, Acc) ->
  755:                               case binary:split(App, <<"-">>) of
  756:                                   [Name, _Version] ->
  757:                                       Acc#{binary_to_atom(Name) => binary_to_list(App)};
  758:                                   [_] ->
  759:                                       Acc
  760:                               end
  761:                       end, Map0, Apps),
  762:     read_version_lines(Lines, Map);
  763: read_version_lines([], Map) ->
  764:     Map.
